content:
Hi, great problem. I have a few critiques.

1. As Niako pointed out, excess armor warrants a completely unnecessary check, but if you want to keep the game aspect that's fine I guess.

2. Again as Niako said, probably Medium difficulty is better.

3. Maybe add "Mathematics" or "Arithmetic" tag, the problem basically requires sorting by a particular value (probably shouldn't reveal).

It's probably more "medium" than "easy".

> "Your antimatter beam always deals at least 1 damage."
I understood that as something guaranteed in the given inputs, while, on the contrary, it means you have to set the damage to 1 when the formula leads to ≤0.
I would prefer the given inputs to ensure 0≤ARMOR<10 for cruisers and 0≤ARMOR<20 for fighters.
Note anyway that the ARMOR constraints should be corrected: 1≤ARMOR is incorrect (it can be 0 in the inputs) and ARMOR<1000 is confusing (it should never be that large).

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like the story and particularly the fact that alien ships have different characteristics. 
Accurate difficulty (for an easy puzzle).
Good test cases.
Default code seems to work properly.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: nice problem, test cases that prevent brute force method

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's a good problem and I agree with your difficulty. Very creative and I felt very motivated especially because it was my friend's spaceship.

Nice catch! I think the "at least 1 damage" statement is now clear. I prefer not constraining the armor to <=10 or 20 as a shoutout to those many games (especially older ones) that have the silly exploit where level 1 characters can still technically kill super tanky bosses given enough hits :D.
